items.label: thm-finite-n-lsi-preservation
items.title: Finite-N LSI Preservation (Proven)
items.content:
518: :label: thm-finite-n-lsi-preservation
519: 
520: The N-particle cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}: \Sigma_N \to \Sigma_N$ **preserves the LSI** with controlled constant degradation. Specifically, if a distribution $\mu$ on $\Sigma_N$ satisfies:
521: 
522: $$
523: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) \le C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot I(\mu \| \pi)
524: $$
525: 
526: then the push-forward $\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu$ satisfies:
527: 
528: $$
529: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu \| \Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \pi) \le C'_{\text{LSI}} \cdot I(\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu \| \Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \pi)
530: $$
531: 
532: where $C'_{\text{LSI}} = C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot (1 + O(\delta^2))$ for cloning noise variance $\delta^2$.
533: 
534: **Key mechanism**: The cloning operator introduces small Gaussian noise ($\delta \xi$) when copying walkers, which regularizes the Fisher information and prevents LSI constant blow-up.

items.label: thm-revival-kl-expansive
items.title: Revival Operator is KL-Expansive (VERIFIED)
items.content:
963: :label: thm-revival-kl-expansive
964: 
965: The mean-field revival operator $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d]$ **increases** the KL-divergence to the invariant measure $\pi$:
966: 
967: $$
968: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) \Big|_{\text{revival}} > 0 \quad \text{for all } \rho \neq \pi, \, m_d > 0
969: $$
items.raw_directive:
960: **Conclusion**: Since $D_{\text{KL}} \ge 0$, $\lambda > 0$, $m_d > 0$, and $\|\rho\|_{L^1} > 0$, the entropy production is **strictly positive**.
961: 
962: :::{prf:theorem} Revival Operator is KL-Expansive (VERIFIED)

items.label: thm-qsd-stability
items.title: QSD Stability (Champagnat-Villemonais)
items.content:
1343: :label: thm-qsd-stability
1344: 
1345: Let $\{\mathcal{L}_n\}$ be a sequence of operators with QSDs $\{\rho_n\}$ and absorption rates $\{\lambda_n\}$. Suppose:
1346: 1. $\mathcal{L}_n \to \mathcal{L}_\infty$ in resolvent sense
1347: 2. The QSDs satisfy uniform moment bounds: $\sup_n \int V \rho_n < \infty$ for some Lyapunov $V$
1348: 3. The absorption rates $\lambda_n$ are uniformly bounded away from zero
items.raw_directive:
1340: We now apply the **Champagnat-Villemonais stability theorem** (Champagnat & Villemonais 2017, Theorem 2.2):

items.label: thm-corrected-kl-convergence
items.title: KL-Convergence for Mean-Field Euclidean Gas (CORRECTED)
items.content:
3085: :label: thm-corrected-kl-convergence
3086: 
3087: If the kinetic dominance condition holds:
3088: 
3089: $$
3090: \sigma^2 \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} > C_0 \max\left(\frac{\lambda}{M_\infty}, \bar{\kappa}\right)
3091: $$
3092: 
3093: then the mean-field Euclidean Gas converges exponentially to its QSD:
3094: 
3095: $$
3096: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{B_{\text{jump}}}{\alpha_{\text{net}}} (1 - e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t})
3097: $$
3098: 
3099: where $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \alpha_{\text{kin}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0$.

items.title: Exponential Convergence (Local)
items.content:
3959: :label: thm-exponential-convergence-local
3960: 
3961: Assume $\delta > 0$ and that $\rho_0$ satisfies $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) \le \epsilon_0$ for sufficiently small $\epsilon_0$. Then:
3962: 
3963: $$
3964: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty)
3965: $$
3966: 
3967: where:
3968: 
3969: $$
3970: \boxed{\alpha_{\text{net}} = \frac{\delta}{2}}
3971: $$

items.title: Mean-Field Convergence Rate (Explicit)
items.content:
4450: :label: thm-alpha-net-explicit
4451: 
4452: The mean-field convergence rate as a function of simulation parameters is:
4453: 
4454: $$
4455: \begin{aligned}
4456: \alpha_{\text{net}}(\tau, \gamma, \sigma, \lambda_{\text{revive}}, \kappa_{\max}, L_U) \approx \frac{1}{2} \Bigg[
4457: &\frac{\gamma \sigma^2}{1 + \gamma/\lambda_{\min} + \lambda_{\text{revive}}/(M_\infty \gamma)} \\
4458: &- \frac{2\gamma}{\sigma^2} \left(\sqrt{\frac{\kappa_{\max}}{\sigma^2}} + \sqrt{\frac{L_U}{\gamma}} + \gamma\right) \sigma\tau\sqrt{2d} \\
4459: &- \frac{2\gamma L_U^3}{\sigma^4(1 + \gamma/\lambda_{\min})} \\
4460: &- (C_{\nabla x} + \gamma) \sqrt{2d\sigma^2/\gamma} \\
4461: &- 2\kappa_{\max} - \frac{\kappa_0(\lambda_{\text{revive}} + \kappa_0)^2}{\lambda_{\text{revive}}^2}
4462: \Bigg]
4463: \end{aligned}

items.label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
items.title: Exponential KL-Convergence in the Mean-Field Limit
items.content:
5296: :label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
5297: 
5298: Let $\rho_t$ be the solution to the mean-field McKean-Vlasov-Fokker-Planck PDE for the Euclidean Gas:
5299: 
5300: $$
5301: \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} = \mathcal{L}[\rho] = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}[\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}[\rho]
5302: $$
5303: 
5304: where:
5305: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ is the kinetic operator (Langevin dynamics)
5306: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}$ is the mean-field jump operator (killing + revival)
5307: 
5308: Let $\rho_\infty$ be the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) satisfying the regularity properties R1-R6 established in Stage 0.5.
5309: 
5310: **Assume** the **Kinetic Dominance Condition** holds:
5311: 
5312: $$
5313: \delta := \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0
5314: $$
5315: 
5316: where:
5317: - $\lambda_{\text{LSI}}$ is the Log-Sobolev constant of the QSD (Stage 2, Section 1.2)
5318: - $\sigma$ is the diffusion strength
5319: - $C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling Fisher information bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
5320: - $C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling KL bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
5321: - $A_{\text{jump}}$ is the jump operator expansion coefficient (Stage 2, Section 1.4)
5322: 
5323: **Then** for any initial density $\rho_0$ with finite relative entropy $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) < \infty$, the solution converges exponentially to the QSD:
5324: 
5325: $$
5326: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\delta t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta} (1 - e^{-\delta t})
5327: $$
5328: 
5329: where the offset constant is:
5330: 
5331: $$
5332: C_{\text{offset}} := \frac{\sigma^2}{2} C_{\text{LSI}} + C_0^{\text{coup}} + B_{\text{jump}}
5333: $$
5334: 
5335: with:
5336: - $C_{\text{LSI}}$ from the LSI remainder (Stage 2, Lemma `lem-fisher-bound`)
5337: - $C_0^{\text{coup}}$ from the coupling constant bound (Stage 2, Section 3.3)
5338: - $B_{\text{jump}}$ from the jump operator bound (Stage 2, Section 4.4)
5339: 
5340: **Asymptotic behavior**: As $t \to \infty$,
5341: 
5342: $$
5343: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \to \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta}
5344: $$
5345: 
5346: **Important**: The system converges exponentially to a **residual neighborhood** of the QSD with radius $C_{\text{offset}}/\delta$ in KL-divergence. For true convergence to the QSD (zero residual), $C_{\text{offset}}$ must vanish, which occurs in local basins near equilibrium where higher-order remainder terms become negligible.
5347: 
5348: **Convergence rate**: The effective rate is $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \delta$, with explicit formula:
5349: 
5350: $$
5351: \alpha_{\text{net}} = \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}}
5352: $$

5293: ## 1. Main Theorem Statement
5294: 
5295: :::{prf:theorem} Exponential KL-Convergence in the Mean-Field Limit
5296: :label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
5297: 
5298: Let $\rho_t$ be the solution to the mean-field McKean-Vlasov-Fokker-Planck PDE for the Euclidean Gas:
5299: 
5300: $$
5301: \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} = \mathcal{L}[\rho] = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}[\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}[\rho]
5302: $$
5303: 
5304: where:
5305: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ is the kinetic operator (Langevin dynamics)
5306: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}$ is the mean-field jump operator (killing + revival)
5307: 
5308: Let $\rho_\infty$ be the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) satisfying the regularity properties R1-R6 established in Stage 0.5.
5309: 
5310: **Assume** the **Kinetic Dominance Condition** holds:
5311: 
5312: $$
5313: \delta := \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0
5314: $$
5315: 
5316: where:
5317: - $\lambda_{\text{LSI}}$ is the Log-Sobolev constant of the QSD (Stage 2, Section 1.2)
5318: - $\sigma$ is the diffusion strength
5319: - $C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling Fisher information bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
5320: - $C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling KL bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
5321: - $A_{\text{jump}}$ is the jump operator expansion coefficient (Stage 2, Section 1.4)
5322: 
5323: **Then** for any initial density $\rho_0$ with finite relative entropy $D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) < \infty$, the solution converges exponentially to the QSD:
5324: 
5325: $$
5326: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\delta t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta} (1 - e^{-\delta t})
5327: $$
5328: 
5329: where the offset constant is:
5330: 
5331: $$
5332: C_{\text{offset}} := \frac{\sigma^2}{2} C_{\text{LSI}} + C_0^{\text{coup}} + B_{\text{jump}}
5333: $$
5334: 
5335: with:
5336: - $C_{\text{LSI}}$ from the LSI remainder (Stage 2, Lemma `lem-fisher-bound`)
5337: - $C_0^{\text{coup}}$ from the coupling constant bound (Stage 2, Section 3.3)
5338: - $B_{\text{jump}}$ from the jump operator bound (Stage 2, Section 4.4)
5339: 
5340: **Asymptotic behavior**: As $t \to \infty$,
5341: 
5342: $$
5343: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \to \frac{C_{\text{offset}}}{\delta}
5344: $$
5345: 
5346: **Important**: The system converges exponentially to a **residual neighborhood** of the QSD with radius $C_{\text{offset}}/\delta$ in KL-divergence. For true convergence to the QSD (zero residual), $C_{\text{offset}}$ must vanish, which occurs in local basins near equilibrium where higher-order remainder terms become negligible.
5347: 
5348: **Convergence rate**: The effective rate is $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \delta$, with explicit formula:
5349: 
5350: $$
5351: \alpha_{\text{net}} = \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}}
5352: $$
